meanings.definition: To interlace (threads, yarns, strips, fibrous material, etc.) so as to form a fabric or material.
meanings.sent1: She wove a colorful scarf for her friend.
meanings.sent2: The weaver wove a beautiful tapestry on the loom.
meanings.sent3: The spider wove a web to catch its prey.
meanings.sent4: Her words wove a tale of adventure and mystery.
meanings.sent5: The artist wove magic into every stitch of her creation.
